sentences.tran: 你应当与你的同事友好相处。
sentences.tranLocal: You should keep in with your colleagues.

sentences.tran: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。
sentences.tranLocal: You should not deprecate your own worth.

trans.tranLocal: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

sentences.tran: 六年前我搬到了这个城市。
sentences.tranLocal: I moved to this city six years ago.

sentences.tran: 我没有又迟到吧？
sentences.tranLocal: I’m not late again, am I?

sentences.tran: 我和丈夫喜欢去剧院看戏。
sentences.tranLocal: My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about

sentences.tran: 鲍勃和休说他们来不了。
sentences.tranLocal: Bob and Sue said they wouldn’t be able to come.

sentences.tran: 肯送给我一些花。很漂亮吧？
sentences.tranLocal: Ken gave me some flowers. Aren’t they beautiful?

sentences.tran: 他们都想来参加婚礼。
sentences.tranLocal: They all want to come to the wedding.

trans.tranLocal: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘his or her’

sentences.tran: 他们说服她同意他们的看法。
sentences.tranLocal: They talked her round to their position.

trans.tran: 我们（主格）；笔者，本人（作者或演讲人使用）；朕，寡人
trans.tranLocal: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people

sentences.tran: “你们进超级市场了吗？”“我们没有进去。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Did you go into the supermarket?’ ‘No, we didn’t.’

sentences.tran: 我们停下来喝杯咖啡好吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Shall we stop for a coffee?

sentences.tran: 所以我们一起都去了布赖顿。
sentences.tranLocal: So we all travelled down to Brighton together.

sentences.tran: 我们宣布支持一个全国统一的政府。
sentences.tranLocal: We declare our support for a government of national unity.

sentences.tran: 我们意大利人为自己的历史感到自豪。
sentences.tranLocal: We Italians are proud of our history.

trans.tranLocal: used to ask or talk about which person is involved, or what the name of a person is

sentences.tran: 谁锁的门？
sentences.tranLocal: Who locked the door?

sentences.tran: 你为谁工作？
sentences.tranLocal: Who do you work for?

sentences.tran: 和你妻子在一起的那个人是谁？
sentences.tranLocal: Who’s that guy with your wife?

sentences.tran: 他们一直未查出谁是凶犯。
sentences.tranLocal: They never found out who the murderer was.

sentences.tran: 她不知道是谁送的花。
sentences.tranLocal: She wondered who had sent the flowers.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about
used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘him or her’

sentences.tran: 有人见到我的钥匙吗？我哪儿都找不到。
sentences.tranLocal: Has anyone seen my keys? I can’t find them anywhere.

sentences.tran: 我和警察说了，他们很帮忙。
sentences.tranLocal: The police were very helpful when I spoke to them.

sentences.tran: 我借给他几本书，但他一本还没看过。
sentences.tranLocal: I lent him several books, but he hasn’t read any of them.

sentences.tran: 他向我强调它的重要性。
sentences.tranLocal: He emphasized its importance to me.

sentences.tran: 这个孩子读了这篇故事，但不能理解它的意思。
sentences.tranLocal: The child read the story but did not comprehend its meaning.

sentences.tran: 公司传播有关其新计划的信息。
sentences.tranLocal: The company disseminated information about its new programmes.

phrases.tran: 可以说是，似乎就是；好像

sentences.tran: 他们分享我们的胜利。
sentences.tranLocal: They partook of our triumph.

sentences.tran: 她在草地上摆好了我们的午饭。
sentences.tranLocal: She spread our lunch on the grass.

sentences.tran: 我们向我们的敌人报仇。
sentences.tranLocal: We avenged ourselves on  our enemy.

sentences.tran: 我的朋友并不全都吸烟。
sentences.tranLocal: All my friends do not smoke.

sentences.tran: 那么你一定是我的远亲了。
sentences.tranLocal: Then you must be my cousin.

sentences.tran: 他匆匆记下了那些注解。
sentences.tranLocal: He dotted down those notes.

sentences.tran: 她伙同那些粗野的男孩对付我。
sentences.tranLocal: She ganged up on me with those rough boys.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.tran: “保罗在哪儿？”“他去看电影了。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Where’s Paul?’ ‘He’s gone to the cinema.’

sentences.tran: 是他先提出这个想法的。
sentences.tranLocal: It was he who first suggested the idea.

trans.tranLocal: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people

sentences.tran: 请帮助我们。
sentences.tranLocal: Please help us.

sentences.tran: 他安排我们大家一起喝一杯。
sentences.tranLocal: He arranged for us all to have a drink.

sentences.tran: 我们俩她都请了。
sentences.tranLocal: She’s invited us both.

sentences.tran: 我妈要来和我们同住。
sentences.tranLocal: My mother is coming to stay with us.

sentences.tran: 现在就给我们捐款吧。
sentences.tranLocal: Send us a donation now.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.tran: 简？我不太认识她。
sentences.tranLocal: Jane? I don’t really know her.

sentences.tran: 玛格丽特想让我和她一起去。
sentences.tranLocal: Margaret wants me to go with her.

sentences.tran: 把钥匙给她。
sentences.tranLocal: Give her the keys.

sentences.tran: 我觉得是她，但不肯定。
sentences.tranLocal: I think it was her, but I’m not sure.

trans.tranLocal: used to mean a particular thing when you do not know its name or do not know exactly what it is

trans.tran: 重要的人；值得重视的事

sentences.tran: 我眼睛里有什么东西。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s something in my eye.

sentences.tran: 萨拉说她等一会儿过来什么的。
sentences.tranLocal: Sarah said something about coming over later.

sentences.tran: 我不知道他具体是干什么的，只知道和电脑有关。
sentences.tranLocal: I don’t know what he does exactly, but I know it has something to do with computers (= is related to them in some way ) .

phrases.tran: 或是什么的；诸如此类的什么
有几分；有点儿；可以说是一个
不劳而获之利益；轻易得来的利益
[美国口语] 制造麻烦；引起争吵(或打斗)
[口语] 我猜疑，我感到，我想

trans.tranLocal: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

sentences.tran: 住手，你弄疼我了。
sentences.tranLocal: Stop, you’re hurting me.

sentences.tran: 他给我买了一杯酒。
sentences.tranLocal: He bought me a drink.

sentences.tran: 把那本书给我。
sentences.tranLocal: Give that book to me.

sentences.tran: 她比我大两岁。
sentences.tranLocal: She’s two years older than me.

sentences.tran: 那是我，站在左边的那一个。
sentences.tranLocal: That’s me, standing on the left.

trans.tranLocal: used when talking to someone to show that they are affected by their own action

sentences.tran: 照照镜子吧。
sentences.tranLocal: Look at yourself in the mirror.

sentences.tran: 到火边来暖暖身子。
sentences.tranLocal: Come and warm yourselves by the fire.

sentences.tran: 你伤到自己了吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Have you hurt yourself?

sentences.tran: 去给你自己买个冰激凌吧。
sentences.tranLocal: Go and buy yourself an ice cream.

trans.tranLocal: used to mean a person, when you do not know or do not say who the person is

sentences.tran: 要是有人在街上抢劫你，你会怎么办？
sentences.tranLocal: What would you do if someone tried to rob you in the street?

sentences.tran: 谁能说说是怎么回事？
sentences.tranLocal: Will someone please explain what’s going on?

sentences.tran: 叫布鲁克斯或谁立刻把这个发传真到纽约。
sentences.tranLocal: Have Brooks or someone fax this to New York right away.

trans.tranLocal: each thing or all things

sentences.tran: 所有东西上面都蒙着厚厚一层灰。
sentences.tranLocal: Everything was covered in a thick layer of dust.

sentences.tran: 我决定把一切都告诉她。
sentences.tranLocal: I decided to tell her everything.

sentences.tran: 除了公共汽车晚点之外，其他一切似乎都在按计划进行。
sentences.tranLocal: Apart from the bus arriving late, everything else seemed to be going according to plan.

phrases.tran: 一切事物；以及其他等等
[口语]具有各种优点(或吸引力、所需之物等)

trans.tranLocal: used to show that a thing, organization, animal, or baby that does something is affected by its own action

sentences.tran: 猫躺在沙发上把自己舔干。
sentences.tranLocal: The cat lay on the sofa, washing itself.

sentences.tran: 工作程序结束，机器会自动关闭。
sentences.tranLocal: The machine switches itself off when the process is complete.

sentences.tran: 已发展为业绩喜人的公司的一家小型地方企业
sentences.tranLocal: a small local enterprise that has transformed itself into a highly successful company

trans.tranLocal: every person

sentences.tran: 如果大家都准备好了，我就开始。
sentences.tranLocal: If everyone is ready, I’ll begin.

sentences.tran: 请向全家人致以最美好的祝愿。
sentences.tranLocal: Send my best wishes to everyone in the family.

sentences.tran: 当然其他所有人都觉得好笑极了！
sentences.tranLocal: Of course everyone else thought it was hilarious!

sentences.tran: 并不是谁都喜欢体育运动的。
sentences.tranLocal: Not everyone enjoys sport.

trans.tranLocal: used to show that the people who do something are affected by their own action

sentences.tran: 教师们别无选择，只能采取措施来保护自己。
sentences.tranLocal: Teachers have no choice but to take measures to protect themselves.

sentences.tran: 我们邻居刚刚买了一个按摩浴缸。
sentences.tranLocal: Our neighbours have just bought themselves a jacuzzi.

sentences.tran: 那些孩子好像自得其乐。
sentences.tranLocal: The kids seem very pleased with themselves.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to any person, when it is not important to say exactly who

sentences.tran: 今晚任何人都可能赢。
sentences.tranLocal: Anyone could win tonight.

sentences.tran: 他们为任何有兴趣当老师的人提供帮助和咨询。
sentences.tranLocal: They offer help and advice to anyone interested in becoming a teacher.

sentences.tran: 如果有谁看见莉萨，叫她打电话给我。
sentences.tranLocal: If anyone sees Lisa, ask her to call me.

sentences.tran: 还有谁有兴趣参加此次旅行，下课来找我。
sentences.tranLocal: Anyone else who is interested in going on the trip should see me at the end of this lesson.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.tran: 你爱上他了吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Are you in love with him?

sentences.tran: 你为什么不自己问他？
sentences.tranLocal: Why don’t you ask him yourself?

sentences.tran: 他把她告诉他的话重复了一遍。
sentences.tranLocal: He repeated what she had told him.

sentences.tran: 我一听声音就知道是他。
sentences.tranLocal: I knew it was him as soon as I heard his voice.

sentences.tran: “牙科医生”一词意谓其工作是医治牙齿的医生。
sentences.tranLocal: The word “dentist”denotes a doctor whose work is the care of teeth.

trans.tranLocal: used by the person speaking or writing to show that they are affected by their own action

sentences.tran: 发生这一切都怪我自己。
sentences.tranLocal: I blame myself for what has happened.

sentences.tran: 我可以照顾好自己。
sentences.tranLocal: I can look after myself.

sentences.tran: 我在给自己做三明治。
sentences.tranLocal: I’m making myself a sandwich.

trans.tranLocal: everyone
used by the person speaking to show that they and one or more other people are affected by their own action

sentences.tran: 我们为将要开始的长途旅行做好了准备。
sentences.tranLocal: We prepared ourselves for the long journey ahead.

sentences.tran: 在电视上看到自己感觉很奇怪。
sentences.tranLocal: It was strange seeing ourselves on television.

phrases.tran: 只限于咱们之间；秘密的

sentences.tran: 他收回自己所有的农场。
sentences.tranLocal: He repossessed himself of his farm.

sentences.tran: 他把自己关在里面。
sentences.tranLocal: He barred himself in.

sentences.tran: 他用钢笔划掉了他自己的名字。
sentences.tranLocal: He stroked the name of himself with his pen.

trans.tranLocal: used to mean a person, when you do not know, or do not say who the person is

sentences.tran: 有人等着要见你。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s somebody waiting to see you.

sentences.tran: 不知谁的汽车警报器吵得我整晚都无法入睡。
sentences.tranLocal: Somebody’s car alarm kept me awake all night.

sentences.tran: “我们能请谁来看小孩呢？”“我会叫苏齐或别的什么人。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Who can we get to babysit?’ ‘I’ll call Suzie or somebody .’

list.tran: 重要的人；值得重视的事

trans.tran: 你（们）的东西；你的责任[义务]；你的家属；来信，尊函
trans.tranLocal: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to refer to something that belongs to them or is connected with them

trans.tran: 你（们）的（东西）；信末署名前用语

sentences.tran: 这是我们的房间，你们的在走廊那边。
sentences.tranLocal: This is our room, and yours is just across the hall.

sentences.tran: 许多人有财务问题，不过你的问题比大多数人的要严重。
sentences.tranLocal: A lot of people have money problems, but yours are more serious than most people’s.

sentences.tran: 一万英镑的奖金或一辆新车——随你选择。
sentences.tranLocal: A cash prize of £10,000 or a new car – the choice is yours.

trans.tranLocal: used to show that the woman or girl who does something is affected by her own action

sentences.tran: 碎玻璃把她割伤了。
sentences.tranLocal: She cut herself on some broken glass.

sentences.tran: 她给自己煮了杯咖啡。
sentences.tranLocal: She made herself a cup of coffee.

trans.tran: 谁； 无论谁； 究竟是谁
trans.tranLocal: used to say that it does not matter who does something, is in a particular place etc

sentences.tran: 谁想去我就带谁去。
sentences.tranLocal: I’ll take whoever wants to go.

sentences.tran: 你看完书以后，就给克里斯廷或谢利，或者随便谁都行。
sentences.tranLocal: When you’re done with the book, just give it to Kristin or Shelley or whoever.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to a person or group of people when speaking or writing to them

trans.tran: (You)人名；(柬)尤；(东南亚国家华语)猷

sentences.tran: 嗨，凯利，你好吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Hi, Kelly. How are you?

sentences.tran: 你们大家都必须仔细听着。
sentences.tranLocal: You must all listen carefully.

sentences.tran: 我有一些消息要告诉你们。
sentences.tranLocal: I have some news for you.

sentences.tran: 信是寄给你们俩的。
sentences.tranLocal: The letter is addressed to both of you.

sentences.tran: 罗宾把钱给你了吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Did Robin give you the money?

sentences.tran: 只有你才能作这个决定。
sentences.tranLocal: Only you can make this decision.

sentences.tran: 你这个白痴！
sentences.tranLocal: You idiot!

sentences.tran: 你们这些男孩子必须学着规矩点。
sentences.tranLocal: You boys have got to learn to behave yourselves.

sentences.tran: 嘿，说你呢，让开！
sentences.tranLocal: Hey, you over there! Get out of the way!

phrases.tran: ◎【军事】[用作操练口令]原地不动，还原，复原(指恢复原来的姿势)

trans.tranLocal: used to say how big, how much etc, especially when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands
used after verbs, nouns, and adjectives to introduce a  clause  which shows what someone says or thinks, or states a fact or reason
used after a noun as a  relative pronoun  like ‘who’, ‘whom’, or ‘which’ to introduce a  clause

sentences.tran: 他和他们商量了那个问题。
sentences.tranLocal: He deliberated with them over that question.

trans.tranLocal: used to refer to a thing, animal, situation, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.tran: “你的办公室在哪儿？”“在三楼。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Where’s your office?’ ‘It’s on the third floor.’

sentences.tran: 我喜欢春季——这是一年里最美妙的时节。
sentences.tranLocal: I love the spring – it’s a wonderful time of the year.

sentences.tran: 有人在哭喊，楼房在燃烧―太可怕了！
sentences.tranLocal: There were people crying, buildings on fire. It was terrible!

sentences.tran: 不要责备我，这不是我的主意。
sentences.tranLocal: Don’t blame me. It wasn’t my idea.

sentences.tran: 这小动物是狐猴，生活在马达加斯加。
sentences.tranLocal: This little beast is a lemur and it lives in Madagascar.

phrases.tran: 可以说是，似乎就是；好像

trans.tranLocal: used to say how big, how much etc, when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands

sentences.tran: 那桌子大约有这么高，这么宽。
sentences.tranLocal: The table’s about this high and this wide.

sentences.tran: 你要从管子头上切下大约这么多。
sentences.tranLocal: You need to cut about this much off the end of the pipe.

trans.tranLocal: the thing which

sentences.tran: 给我看看你买的东西。
sentences.tranLocal: Show me what you bought.

sentences.tran: 他的行为很缺德。
sentences.tranLocal: What he did was morally wrong.

phrases.tran: ◎…有什么关系(通常与it， this， that连用)
不管发生什么；无论如何
诸如此类（等于and 等等（等于what have you）；what have you或what not）
有分辨能力；内行，懂行；有头脑(或经验)，精明，老练

sentences.tran: 在这些事情上我们都听她的。
sentences.tranLocal: We all defer to her in these matters.

sentences.tran: 这些都是你的吗?
sentences.tranLocal: Are these all yours?

sentences.tran: 当你出去走入社会时你把这些思想牢记在心。
sentences.tranLocal: Bear these thoughts with you as you go out into the world.

sentences.tran: 他向我说明了他的观点。
sentences.tranLocal: He stated his views to me.

trans.tran: 她（主格）；它（用来指雌性动物或国家、船舶、地球、月亮等）
trans.tranLocal: used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about
used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.tran: 你总是可以去问贝丝——她有很多钱。
sentences.tranLocal: You could always ask Beth – she’s got plenty of money.

sentences.tran: 我看见你和那个女孩子说话。 她是谁？
sentences.tranLocal: I saw you talking to that girl. Who is she?

sentences.tran: 你告诉她时她怎么说？
sentences.tranLocal: What did she say when you told her?

trans.tranLocal: a large amount or number

trans.tran: （与形容词和副词连用）很，非常；（与动词连用）非常
trans.tranLocal: A lot means to a great extent or degree
a large amount or number

trans.tran: 分组，把…划分（常与out连用）；把（土地）划分成块

sentences.tran: 我们在孩子的教育上花费甚多。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ve spent a lot on the children’s education.

sentences.tran: “你有多少张CD？”“多着呢。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘How many CDs have you got?’ ‘Lots.’

sentences.tran: 马修经常出去做研究。
sentences.tranLocal: Matthew's out quite a lot doing his research.

sentences.tran: 我非常喜欢你。
sentences.tranLocal: I like you, a lot.

phrases.tran: 经常和…在一起；经常见到
非常有意思；很大的乐趣

trans.tranLocal: any thing, event, situation etc, when it is not important to say exactly which

sentences.tran: 你想要什么都可以买。
sentences.tranLocal: You can buy anything you want.

sentences.tran: 只要能赚一点钱，他什么都愿意做。
sentences.tranLocal: He was prepared to do anything to make a bit of money.

sentences.tran: 做什么都比待在家里好！
sentences.tranLocal: Anything would be better than staying at home!

sentences.tran: 你可以写游泳、写滑雪或者其他任何你喜欢的活动。
sentences.tranLocal: You can write about swimming, skiing, or anything else you enjoy doing.

phrases.tran: 或者其他别的事，或其他什么的
无论如何（用于否定句中）
[委婉语](女子)见潮红，来例假[系“有喜了”的委婉说法]
（用于疑问或条件句）多多少少；一点…的味儿；很少
[口]拼命地；非常猛地；全力地；象什么似的
怎么都行；任何事情都可能发生
胜任各项工作；对一切都适用

trans.tran: [用于否定句中以加强语气]任何； 无论什么
trans.tranLocal: used to emphasize a negative statement

sentences.tran: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。
sentences.tranLocal: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.

sentences.tran: 这只是一场无聊的争论，和你的工作没有任何关系。
sentences.tranLocal: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.

trans.tranLocal: no one

sentences.tran: 我敲了敲门，但没人应门。
sentences.tranLocal: I knocked on the door but nobody answered.

phrases.tran: 没人能做到；那么别人也休想

list.tran: 头；大人物；[建] 球形门柄

trans.tranLocal: not any amount of something or not one of a group of people or things
not having any more understanding or knowledge about something than you had before

sentences.tran: 我真想能请你吃些蛋糕，但一点也没剩的了。
sentences.tranLocal: I wish I could offer you some cake but there’s none left.

sentences.tran: 虽然这些都是好学生，但是没有一个考到60分以上。
sentences.tranLocal: Although these were good students, none had a score above 60.

sentences.tran: 她等着答复，可是什么也没等到。
sentences.tranLocal: She waited for a reply, but none came.

sentences.tran: 有一辆旧车也比没有车强。
sentences.tranLocal: Even an old car is better than none.

trans.tran: 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷

trans.tranLocal: to dig large holes in the ground in order to remove coal, gold etc
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

sentences.tran: 他们学习了如何布雷。
sentences.tranLocal: They learnt how to lay mines (= put them in place ) .

phrases.tran: 酸性矿水排水；排泄酸性矿水

list.tran: 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）
使成矿（mineralize的过去式和过去分词）
使含无机化合物；使矿物化

sentences.tran: 不要轻信任何人，你得亲自去试一试。
sentences.tranLocal: You should have a try, don't swallow anybody.

sentences.tran: 她向我发誓不把我的秘密告诉任何人。
sentences.tranLocal: She swore me not to tell anybody about my secret.

sentences.tran: 我们不应该轻视任何人，即使他是一个小人物。
sentences.tranLocal: We shouldn't slight anybody even if he's a nobody.

trans.tran: 一些；某个；大约；相当多的
一些；若干；其中的一部分；（数量不确切时用）有些人
trans.tranLocal: a number of people or things or an amount of something, when the exact number or amount is not stated
a fairly large number or amount of something

sentences.tran: 我刚煮了一壶咖啡，你想喝点吗？
sentences.tranLocal: I’ve just made a pot of coffee. Would you like some?

sentences.tran: “你知道螺丝钉在哪儿吗？”“车库里有一些。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Do you know where the screws are?’ ‘There are some in the garage.’

list.tran: 重要的人；值得重视的事

trans.tran: 在那里；在那边；在那点上
trans.tranLocal: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do

sentences.tran: 我们可以回到我的小屋去吃午饭。
sentences.tranLocal: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.

sentences.tran: 苏格兰？我一直想去那儿。
sentences.tranLocal: Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.

sentences.tran: 就站在那里，不要动。
sentences.tranLocal: Hold it right there and don’t move.

sentences.tran: 你能把那个葡萄酒杯递给我吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Can you pass me that wine glass there?

sentences.tran: 看，那就是我跟你说过的那家书店。
sentences.tranLocal: Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.

sentences.tran: 那边的那个男人是谁？
sentences.tranLocal: Who’s that man over there ?

sentences.tran: 一天开车来回太远了。
sentences.tranLocal: It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.

sentences.tran: 银行关门之前，我们到得了吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Are we going to get there (= arrive ) before the banks close?

phrases.tran: 到达那里；取得成功，实现目标
这边请；这下你会懂了；你又来这一套
不相干；与题目不相干；不重要

list.tran: 从而，因此；在那附近；在那方面

phrases.tran: 等等；的确；此外；连…一齐都
到处，遍及；浑身；全部结束
总而言之；头等重要的东西

trans.tranLocal: in or to which place

sentences.tran: 你要到哪儿去？
sentences.tranLocal: Where are you going?

sentences.tran: 他们住在哪里？
sentences.tranLocal: Where do they live?

sentences.tran: 你知道我的眼镜在哪儿吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Do you know where my glasses are?

sentences.tran: 你想坐在哪里？
sentences.tranLocal: Where would you like to sit?

phrases.tran: [口]问题的关键所在；实际情况

sentences.tran: 你能举出另一个像这样的例子吗?
sentences.tranLocal: Can you cite another case like this one?

phrases.tran: adv. 接连地；一个接一个地
adv. 无论如何；以某种方法
同种类中的另一个[见 such]

trans.tran: 相同的；同一的；上述的（通常与the连用）；无变化的
trans.tranLocal: used to say that a particular person or thing does not change

trans.tran: 同样的事物或人（通常与the连用）
trans.tranLocal: used to say that two or more people or things are exactly like each other
in the same way

sentences.tran: 她身上的香水给我的感觉一如既往。
sentences.tranLocal: Her perfume has always had the same effect on me.

sentences.tran: 他还是以前那个彼得——喜怒无常且爱发火。
sentences.tranLocal: He’s the same old Peter – moody and irritable.

phrases.tran: 同样；同样的方法；同样的感受
还是；完全一样；照旧（等于all the same）
彼此彼此；我也这样祝愿你

trans.tran: 某一；必然的；确信；无疑的；有把握的
trans.tranLocal: confident and sure, without any doubts
particular people or things in a group

sentences.tran: 我感觉自己肯定通过这次测验了。
sentences.tranLocal: I felt certain that I’d passed the test.

trans.tranLocal: not anything or no thing
to have no qualities or features that are similar to someone or something else

sentences.tran: 这镇上从来都不会发生什么特别的事。
sentences.tranLocal: Nothing ever happens in this town.

sentences.tran: 这盒子里什么也没有。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s nothing in this box.

sentences.tran: 医生们没有别的办法了。
sentences.tranLocal: There was nothing else the doctors could do.

sentences.tran: 他没有更多要说的了。
sentences.tranLocal: He had nothing more to say.

sentences.tran: 我们对她的家庭一无所知。
sentences.tranLocal: We know nothing about her family.

sentences.tran: 我不能就那样袖手旁观。
sentences.tranLocal: I couldn’t just stand by and do nothing.

sentences.tran: 我答应这件事对谁也不说。
sentences.tranLocal: I promised to say nothing about it to anyone.

sentences.tran: 我们好几个星期没有她的音信了。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ve heard nothing from her for weeks.

sentences.tran: 根本没有什么好难为情的。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s absolutely nothing to be ashamed of.

sentences.tran: “你对做生意了解得多吗？”“一窍不通。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Do you know much about business?’ ‘Nothing at all.’

sentences.tran: 晚饭她几乎什么也没吃。
sentences.tranLocal: She had eaten virtually nothing at supper.

sentences.tran: 这些数据没什么差错。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s nothing wrong with the data.

sentences.tran: 这没有什么新鲜的。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s nothing new about this.

sentences.tran: 他们简单地搜查了一番，没发现任何异常。
sentences.tranLocal: A brief search was made but they found nothing untoward.

phrases.tran: 没有什么能比得上；一点也不象
完全是；不亚于；与…一模一样
简直就是；无异于…；简直不比…差

list.tran: 虚无，不存在；空白；不存在的状态

trans.tranLocal: the type of person you are, your character, your typical behaviour etc

sentences.tran: 儿童逐渐形成的自我意识
sentences.tranLocal: a child’s developing sense of self

list.tran: 自私自利；自我中心；任性

trans.tranLocal: not in any place or to any place

sentences.tran: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。
sentences.tranLocal: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.

phrases.tran: 不知打哪儿来；突然冒出来；莫名其妙的出现
